channel.title: Blog Post on Romain Thomas
channel.description: Recent content in Blog Post on Romain Thomas

item.title: Fuzzing Windows ARM64 closed-source binary
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: This blog post introduces coverage-guided fuzzing with QBDI and libFuzzer targeting Windows ARM64.

item.title: Instrumenting an Apple Vision Pro Library with QBDI
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: This blog post demonstrates how to extract liblockdown.dylib from the visionOS dyld shared cache to be instrumented with QBDI on an Apple M1.

item.title: iCDump: A Modern Objective-C Class Dump
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: This blog post introduces iCDump, an new Objective-C class dump based on LLVM

item.title: Open-Obfuscator: A free and open-source obfuscator for mobile applications
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: This blog post introduces open-obfuscator, a new open-source project to obfuscate mobile applications.

item.title: Part 2 – iOS Native Code Obfuscation and Syscall Hooking
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: This second blog post deals with native code obfuscation and RASP syscall interception

item.title: Part 1 – SingPass RASP Analysis
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: This first blog post introduces the RASP checks used in SingPass

item.title: A Journey in iOS App Obfuscation
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: This series of blog posts details how obfuscators can protect iOS applications from reverse engineering

item.title: PGSharp: Analysis of a Cheating App for PokemonGO
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: This blog post is about the internal mechanisms of PGSharp, a cheat engine for PokemonGO.

item.title: Gotta Catch 'Em All: Frida & jailbreak detection
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: This blog post analyzes the Frida and Jailbreak detection in PokemonGO for iOS.

item.title: r2-pay: whitebox (part 2)
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: This second blog post explains how to recover the whitebox’s key from the obfuscated library libnative-lib.so

item.title: r2-pay: anti-debug, anti-root & anti-frida (part 1)
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: This first blog post describes the protections in the challenge r2-pay.

item.title: A Glimpse Into Tencent's Legu Packer
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: Analysis of Tencent Legu: a packer for Android applications.

item.title: Android Native Library Analysis with QBDI
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: This blog post deals with QBDI and how it can be used to reverse an Android JNI library

item.title: Android crackme challenge
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: Android crackme that uses system’s internals

item.title: Android OAT formats
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: Internal structures of OAT format

item.title: Android VDEX formats
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: Internal structures of VDEX format

item.title: When SideChannelMarvels meets LIEF
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: On how we used LIEF to lift an Android x86_64 library to Linux to perform our usual white-box attacks on it.

item.title: How to use frida on a non-rooted device
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: This post explains how to use Frida gadget on a non-rooted device.

item.title: Have fun with LIEF and Executable Formats
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: This blog post introduces new features of LIEF as well as some uses cases.

item.title: Open-sourcing LIEF
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: We are open-sourcing LIEF, a library to parse and manipulate ELF, PE and Mach-O binary formats. This blog post explains the purpose of this project and some parts of its architecture.

item.title: HITB 2015 Write-up - Crypto 300
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: Write-up for the Crypto 300 challenge

item.title: HITB 2015 Write-up - Crypto 400
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: Write up

item.title: Code coverage using a dynamic symbolic execution
item.author: me@romainthomas.fr (Romain Thomas)
item.description: This blog post introduces code coverage with Triton
